page.title: 06The Farming Year
page.content: In{winter}there is quite a lot to do.All the animals are in the shed and we have to feed them morning and night.We feed them hay and cake.When it starts to snow there is even more work to do because we have to dig ourselves out. In{spring}there's also a lot to do because it's lambing time.We stay up nearly all night.After lambing is over we normally have tame lambs to feed. They are pests most of the time because they are always trying to get in the garden. In {summer}there is hay and silage to make.It is very hot and tiring. First we have to cut the hay then we turn it till it's dry. Finally we bale it. At the end of{Autumn}the cows are brought into the shed ready for winter and the ewes mate with the rams.
